We had a busy time
today.
A morning long session with our CNAC
partners going over the business of the last
two months
Company
moved here
from Shanghai.
Then lunch at the Y.M.C.A.
and in
the afternoon
we journeyed
across the
Yangssze to Wuchang to
the airplane factory which was moved here after the Japs attacked 1t
at Hangchow.
It was very interesting as we
were shown

Wong Su,
and he
the bombing of
Hangehow
a hectic move by truck, train, river and coolie power.
Tonight we dine at 8 with the American Consul, Mr.Josselyn.
I
am going to mail
letter now by Eurasia
to Hongkong and from there
by Clipper to my
who is

the Phillippines.
make a number of
Another installment
will
follow some time soon.
We are leaving
tomorrow, Oct. 28th, for Nanking,
by
British steamer.
There it will not be so quiet and
peaceful as here but I think quite
safe.
Conditions on the spot are never as bad
as the newspapers
would
lead you
to believe.
The further removed from the scene the
worse
the reports.
As ever,

Gabulo,
